tr.td: A healthcare provider accesses a summary view of a patient’s medication history
The healthcare provides identifies a clinical need to access a patient’s medication history. This could happen as part of some other process (e.g. e-prescribing) or as a stand-alone process.
The healthcare provider has been authenticated and has searched for and selected a patient from the Client Registry.
The healthcare provider is able to view a summary of the patient’s medication history within their clinical system.

ol.li: The DIS (Drug Information System) will keep audit records for each medication profile query made.

Prescriptions returned by the DIS will include: Prescriptions ordered but not dispensed; Prescriptions ordered and partially or completely dispensed; Prescriptions dispensed with no order (Inferred prescriptions); and Other (i.e. non-prescription, OTC) medications Retracted records do not come back in query responses.

The DIS currently maintains 25 months of medication history profile information online. Access to information that is archived may be available via a manual process by contacting the Jurisdictional help desk.
